sourcesContent:
import React from "react" import axios from 'axios' //path must be changed accordingly to the param query input import XMLData from './xml/mc.xml' class Question extends React.Component{ questionNum = this.props.questionNum //{questionNum} = this.props.questionNum <= why does this raise an error???? state = { questionText: "" } componentDidMount(){ axios.get(XMLData, {"Content-Type":"application/xml; charset=utf-8" }).then((response)=>{ //there is no need to parse this everytime there is a mount, //only need to parse it when the page is loaded const parser = new DOMParser() var xml = parser.parseFromString(response.data,"text/xml") var questionText = xml.getElementsByTagName("questiontext")[this.questionNum].childNodes[0] console.log(questionText) //console.log(question[this.questionNum].innerHTML) <= should I use innerHTML?? this.setState({ questionText: questionText }) }) } render(){ return(

) } } export default Question
